Module phpjavabridge
Package api.syntaxerror.phpjavabridge

Class Bridge

java.lang.Object
api.syntaxerror.phpjavabridge.Bridge
Direct Known Subclasses:
BridgeImpl.TCP, BridgeImpl.UDP
public abstract class Bridge
extends java.lang.Object
PHP-Java-Bridge provides a TCP- or UDP-based connection between PHP (Client) and Java (Server)

    void setDefaultPacketHandler​(PacketHandler handler)
    If a Packet couldn't be handled (because there was no PacketHandler set via setPacketHandler(PacketHandler, int...)), this handler is called.

    If there is no default PacketHandler either, a UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.
    void setExceptionHandler​(java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler exceptionHandler)
    A Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler prevents the Bridge from stopping if an Exception occured.
    void setPacketHandler​(PacketHandler handler, int... pids)
    Defines a PacketHandler for specific Packet-IDs.

    If there is no PacketHandler defined for a Packet-ID and no default Packet is set via setDefaultPacketHandler(PacketHandler), a UnsupportedOperationException is thrown if such a Packet is received
    void start()
    Starts the Server-Thread.
    void stop()
    Stops the Server Thread.
    You cannot call start() afterwards.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getPort

      public int getPort()

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the Server-Thread.

    • stop

      public void stop() throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      Stops the Server Thread.
      You cannot call start() afterwards.
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - thrown by Thread.join()

    • setDefaultPacketHandler

      public void setDefaultPacketHandler​(PacketHandler handler)
      If a Packet couldn't be handled (because there was no PacketHandler set via setPacketHandler(PacketHandler, int...)), this handler is called.

      If there is no default PacketHandler either, a UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      handler - the new default PacketHandler

    • setPacketHandler

      public void setPacketHandler​(PacketHandler handler, int... pids)
      Defines a PacketHandler for specific Packet-IDs.

      If there is no PacketHandler defined for a Packet-ID and no default Packet is set via setDefaultPacketHandler(PacketHandler), a UnsupportedOperationException is thrown if such a Packet is received
      Parameters:
      handler - the PacketHandler
      pids - the Packet-IDs where this PacketHandler should be used

    • setExceptionHandler

      public void setExceptionHandler​(java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler exceptionHandler)
      A Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler prevents the Bridge from stopping if an Exception occured.
      Parameters:
      exceptionHandler - the Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

      Creates a new TCP-Bridge

      see TCP(int, boolean, String, int)
      Returns:
      TCP-based Bridge

    • newTCP

      public static Bridge newTCP​(int port, int maxPacketLength)
      Creates a new TCP-Bridge

      see Bridge(int, boolean, String, int)
      see TCP(int, boolean, String, int)
      Parameters:
      port - the port to be used
      maxPacketLength - the max. length of a single Packet
      Returns:
      TCP-based Bridge

    • newTCP

      public static Bridge newTCP​(int port, boolean useAES, java.lang.String password)
      Creates a new TCP-Bridge

      see Bridge(int, boolean, String, int)
      see TCP(int, boolean, String, int)
      Parameters:
      port - the port to be used
      useAES - whether or not AES-256-CBC should be used. requires password
      password - the password to be used. Required by AES
      Returns:
      TCP-based Bridge

    • newTCP
